2_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf.body:
> [balmung83](#comment_1_1NiUW4YCNDYTij7D8TfFJHK4zNYc3LKxKg): It would be nice, if the guy (or girl) who made this site would enable the cloning-feature.

Sorry, my bad.  Unfortunately I lost the private key for that site.  However, you can still clone the site manually.  
In your zeronet folder go to data/1C2JhCunGLtvyX56nQ88tcb87WnXspjWN and copy the contents into a new (empty) site.  Delete the data folder (data/1C2JhCunGLtvyX56nQ88tcb87WnXspjWN/data/), then edit content-default.json in data/1C2JhCunGLtvyX56nQ88tcb87WnXspjWN/data-default/users/ to change the "signs" var for your site address and sig, and also increase the max_size of the permission_rules for ".*" to something like 1000000.  Don't touch the cert_signers thing.  You might need to run zeronet with the --debug option the first time to get it to create the new database.

I hope I haven't missed anything out here.  Note, the code for this is a bit hacky, if you want to play around with the code and improve the way files are handled, have a look at the sourcecode for zerotorrent.bit

Sorry about that i think I missed out a step.  I managed to find the private key for the site.  Cloning is enabled now (tested it out quickly and it works ok).  Post back if you have any problems.
